title: The Klabautermann Was Created by Joy Boy
summary: A theory suggesting that the Klabautermann phenomenon was created by the Great Kingdom/Joy Boy to protect ships from the great flood that threatened to sink the world.
fullText: This theory proposes that the Klabautermann may have been created by the Great Kingdom as a protective measure against the imminent danger of the great flood that was about to sink the world into the sea. The ship spirits would ensure that well-loved vessels could continue sailing and protecting their crews even in the most dire circumstances. This would explain why the Klabautermann appears to ships that are deeply loved and cared for by their crews - it's a remnant of ancient technology or magic designed to preserve important vessels during catastrophic events.
author: Worstgen Forum User

source.title: Theory - The Klabautermann was created by Joyboy

title: Imu is a Klabautermann of the Ancient Kingdom
summary: A theory proposing that Imu, the mysterious leader of the World Government, is actually the Klabautermann (ship spirit) of the Ancient Kingdom, which was itself a giant ship.
fullText: Reddit user GreatGomp presented a theory that Imu might be a Klabautermann of the Ancient Kingdom. The theory suggests that the Ancient Kingdom was essentially a giant ship that continuously sailed throughout the One Piece seas, similar to how Germa66's Kingdom is a ship. Imu's immortality may be due to the longevity of the ship of the Ancient Kingdom itself, possibly connected to the Mother Flame. According to this theory, Imu is trying to keep the Ancient Kingdom a secret to save himself from the guilt of letting the people on his ship die. This would explain Imu's mysterious nature and connection to the world's ancient history. The first appearance of the Klabautermann in Episode 167 may have been foreshadowing this massive reveal.
author: GreatGomp (Reddit)

source.title: One Piece: One Fan Presents A Theory For How The Klabautermann Will Remain Relevant In The Final Saga

title: Enel Will Return from the Moon with Ancient Technology
summary: A theory that Enel will return from the moon using the Ark Maxim, bringing knowledge of ancient technology and the origins of Sky People to play a role in the final war.
fullText: After his defeat by Luffy in the Skypiea arc, Enel departed to the moon using his Ark Maxim. On the moon, he discovered through wall paintings that Skypieans, Shandians, and Birkans all originated from the moon city, and the inhabitants left for the Blue Planet after using up their resources. Recent chapters have suggested that the Ark Maxim may have been inspired by the Ancient Weapon Uranus. The theory proposes that Enel will return to the Blue Planet during the final war, bringing with him crucial information about the ancient civilization, the three worlds (moon, sky, and sea), and possibly ancient technology or allies from the moon. His return would provide key lore about the Moon People and could make him a wild card in the final conflict - neither fully allied with the Straw Hats nor the World Government. The mention of the Ark Maxim in Episode 167 was the first hint of this grand plan.
author: Multiple Reddit and Forum Users

source.title: Like It or Not, One Piece Just Set Up the Return of Its Most Controversial Villain

title: The Ark Maxim Is Based on Ancient Weapon Uranus
summary: A theory suggesting that Enel's Ark Maxim, first mentioned in Episode 167, was designed based on blueprints or knowledge of the Ancient Weapon Uranus.
fullText: Recent manga chapters have shown a ship resembling the Ark Maxim in ancient murals, suggesting Enel likely drew inspiration from the Ancient Weapon Uranus to create his flying ship. The theory proposes that either the blueprints for Uranus existed on Birka (Enel's homeland) or on Skypiea, or that the Ark Maxim itself might be a prototype or incomplete version of Uranus. This would explain how Enel, despite being from an isolated sky island, was able to construct a ship capable of reaching the moon. The technology required for such a feat would need to come from the ancient civilization. When Enel mentioned his 'dream world' and the nearly-complete Ark Maxim in Episode 167, he may have been unknowingly working with ancient technology that will become crucial to understanding the world's history and the final war.
author: GameRant Analysis Team

title: Usopp's Connection to the Klabautermann Foreshadows His Role as a Brave Warrior
summary: A theory that Usopp being the first to witness the Klabautermann in Episode 167 foreshadows his eventual growth into a true brave warrior of the sea.
fullText: Usopp being chosen as the first crew member to witness the Klabautermann is significant. The theory suggests this wasn't random - the ship spirit appeared to Usopp specifically because of his deep love for the Going Merry and his role as the ship's unofficial repairman. Despite his cowardice, Usopp had the strongest emotional bond with the ship, treating it with care and respect that the others didn't always show. This moment in Episode 167 foreshadows Usopp's character development and his eventual confrontation with Luffy over the Going Merry's fate in Water 7. The Klabautermann appearing to Usopp validates his feelings and his role as the heart of the crew - the one who maintains their bonds and their ship. It's also seen as foreshadowing his eventual achievement of becoming a brave warrior of the sea, as someone worthy of witnessing and understanding the ship's spirit.
author: CBR Staff

source.title: One Piece: Usopp's Love For Going Merry Made a Miracle Happen, Not the Straw Hats
